{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3584575,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-09T00:15:52.548Z","cooked":"

Hi. Now that our season is over, my team wants to try and tackle field localization to improve our Autons and not have to rely on perfect placement of the robot. I thought it might be best for me to first understand the expectations and limitations of using field localization. During the offseason we plan to assemble a basic ctre-based swerve chassis and use swerve generator to produce the drivetrain code. We’ll mount a single limelight 3 on it to track apriltags. Our first basic experiment will be to see if we can use pathplanner to create an auton that just drives straight and stops 12" directly in front of an apriltag (that part we know how to do). The question I have is, using the single limelight, should we be able to call the drivetrain’s addVisionMeasurement() method and feed it data from the limelighthelper class so that we can start the robot off anywhere within in a 5’ radius (as long it can see the apriltag) and have it still end up at the desired location? That’s my understanding of what field localization can do for us. I’m just wondering if we are missing a step or two.

See picture for reference A, B, and C are alternative starting locations. I currently just picked April Tag 8 from Reefscape. It will be the only visible apriltag. We are able to change this out for any of the apriltags if needed.

image1123×1389 34.8 KB

You’re correct about all of that.

All you need to do is feed your drivetrain’s addVisionMeasurement method your MegaTag2’s pose estimate.

Setting up MegaTag2 is where you’ll spend most of your time, making sure you’re calling setRobotOrientation, and that you’ve setup your Camera’s position properly in the UI, and that you’re on the latest firmware are common issues.

As for the swapping out the April tags part, I would be careful with how you implement that. There are 2 ways to align yourself, using Pose (your positional estimate on the field), or using your x and y values read from the camera.

If you’re using Pose to align to the tag, make sure your robot’s rotation is correct for the respective tag you’re looking at.

Other than that, you should be good!
Please let me know if you have any questions.

Yes, this is completely doable. My team has been working on a similar concept for reef alignment. We’ve had issues with MegaTag2 being about 90 degrees off, so we have used MegaTag. As for swapping out tags, you can retrieve the ID of the tag you are looking at and then use the AprilTagFieldLayout to get the pose of that tag and do some pose math in order to find your desired ending pose.

If you’d like, I’ll link my teams code and you can take a look.

Thanks for the feedback Alexander and Jacob. I wanted to make sure my expectations were realistic. My comments about switching out the april tags was only meant to say that we aren’t tied to any specfiic april tag. I’ll pick one that is appropriate so that we can make a proper path with pathplanner so that the robot start on the field. I’m always up for looking at other code to see how other teams are handling things like calculating the confidence factors and when and where they are calling the addVisionMeasurement(). I think the ctre example shows it being added to robotPeriodic() so I’m guessing we’ll start there.
